intro: Dolicholus macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited dolicholus, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruits are large, berry-like structures that contain several seeds. The botanical features of Dolicholus macrocarpus make it a notable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
